Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper body of a wheel-made, pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially grey in section and contains a number of small white inclusions, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 2 wine.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393470) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393470)
